Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, now very worn, is covered with a self-slip and remains of at least ten lines of black-painted Greek text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393848) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393848)
